result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Mervelle Parkman III

records.addlTxt:
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. **Phone contact allowed while in custody, not to discuss this case**
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Pick up personal belongings with police escort.  
Comply with day reporting requirements - UA's and GPS

11:29 AM Defendant Thomas Mervelle Parkman III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maryanne KIRCHER in court for Thomas Mervelle Parkman III.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Advised of Rights. Complaint received, waived reading. NG plea entered. Probable cause found in complaint. 950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 11:45 am.
